ground_truth: She unpacks a rabbit. A plate of vegetables and a fish with a gaping mouth is slid in front of Zoe. Zoe sits and stares at her dinner in horror, as Kate squeezes lemon over her fish. Zoe shakes her head. Kate's smile fades and she looks disappointed as Zoe gets up and leaves the table. Zoe sits in her bedroom, playing with a red-haired rag doll. Zoe looks sadly down at her doll as Kate goes. Patrons sitting in a window table smile and chat as they enjoy a meal. Kate rounds a corner and enters the restaurant, walking straight past Paula who's standing by the door chatting to two customers. Kate makes her way through the crowded dining area. Hearing singing, Kate slows down as she nears the kitchen. She meets Bernadette coming out with two plates. Kate walks into the kitchen. Leah's standing with a man holding a pastry brush. The man turns. He conducts. Kate watches in disbelief as the man raises his arms in the air and sings to the staff. He's holding an uncooked quail in his other hand. Kate turns to Paula. Kate whisks the man's coat off him. Paula leads the couple to their table. Kate and Paula go into a small glass-fronted room filled with well-stocked, floor-to-ceiling wine racks. Kate's speechless. She looks over at Nick, who stands grinning at her. Kate points at a pan on the stove next to him. The contents have caught fire. Kate shakes her head at Paula in disbelief, then grabs her bag and heads out. A flicker of a smile plays on Paula's lips. Kate wearily climbs the stairs to her apartment. A packet of chopsticks have been sellotaped to her door. She bends down and picks up a plastic take-away bag. She takes the chopsticks off the door and walks inside. She walks down the hallway to Zoe's bedroom. Kate pokes her head around the open door, then tries to enter her own bedroom. The door won't budge. She forces it open a crack. Kate sees Zoe curled up, asleep on her bed. Kate walks into the bathroom and enters her bedroom through an adjoining door. A chair has been propped up against the bedroom door to prevent anyone from entering. Kate walks over and moves it aside, along with a wicker laundry basket. Kate steps slowly towards the bed and picks up the remote control, which is lying next to Zoe. She turns off the TV. Kate looks down at her sleeping niece, then places the remote on a chest of drawers. She gently covers Zoe with the bedclothes, then notices a photo album, which had been hidden beneath them. Kate moves the photo album around and begins to look through it.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She unpacks a hare. A dish of greens and a fish with an agape mouth is slid in front of Zoe. Zoe sits and gazes at her supper in terror, as Kate squeezes lemon over her fish. Zoe shakes her head. Kate's grin diminishes and she appears disheartened as Zoe rises and departs the table. Zoe sits in her chamber, toying with a red-haired cloth doll. Zoe glances mournfully down at her doll as Kate goes. Customers seated at a glass table beam and converse as they relish a feast. Kate rounds a bend and enters the bistro, strolling directly past Paula who's standing by the entrance chatting to two patrons. Kate makes her way through the packed eating space. Hearing vocalizing, Kate decelerates as she approaches the galley. She encounters Bernadette emerging with two dishes. Kate walks into the galley. Leah's standing with a gentleman holding a pastry brush. The gentleman turns. He orchestrates. Kate observes in incredulity as the gentleman lifts his limbs in the air and warbles to the personnel. He's clutching an uncooked quail in his other hand. Kate turns to Paula. Kate whisks the gentleman's jacket off him. Paula escorts the pair to their table. Kate and Paula enter a compact glass-panelled chamber filled with well-stocked, floor-to-ceiling wine racks. Kate's speechless. She glances over at Nick, who stands beaming at her. Kate points at a skillet on the stove adjacent to him. The contents have ignited. Kate shakes her head at Paula in disbelief, then grabs her satchel and heads out. A flicker of a grin plays on Paula's lips. Kate wearily climbs the steps to her flat. A package of chopsticks have been taped to her door. She bends down and picks up a plastic take-away sack. She takes the chopsticks off the door and walks inside. She walks down the corridor to Zoe's chamber. Kate pokes her head around the open door, then attempts to enter her own chamber. The door won't budge. She forces it open a crack. Kate sees Zoe curled up, asleep on her bed. Kate walks into the washroom and enters her chamber through an adjoining door. A chair has been propped up against the chamber door to prevent anyone from entering. Kate walks over and moves it aside, along with a wicker laundry container. Kate steps slowly towards the bed and picks up the remote control, which is lying next to Zoe. She turns off the television. Kate looks down at her slumbering niece, then places the remote on a chest of drawers. She gently covers Zoe with the bedclothes, then notices a photo album, which had been concealed beneath them. Kate shifts the photo album around and begins to peruse it.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: She unpacks a rabbit. A plate of vegetables and a fish with a gaping mouth is slid in front of Zoe. Zoe sits and stares at her dinner in horror, as lemon is squeezed by Kate over her fish. Zoe shakes her head. Kate's smile fades and she looks disappointed as the table is left by Zoe. In her bedroom, a red-haired rag doll is played with by Zoe as she sits. Zoe looks sadly down at her doll as Kate goes. Patrons sitting in a window table smile and chat as they enjoy a meal. A corner is rounded by Kate, who enters the restaurant, walking straight past Paula, standing by the door and chatting to two customers. Her way is made by Kate through the crowded dining area. Hearing singing, she slows down as the kitchen is neared by her. Bernadette is met by her coming out with two plates. The kitchen is entered by Kate. Leah's standing with a man holding a pastry brush. The man turns. He conducts. Kate watches in disbelief as his arms are raised by the man in the air and he sings to the staff. An uncooked quail is held by him in his other hand. Paula is turned to by Kate. The man's coat is whisked off him by Kate. The couple is led by Paula to their table. Kate and Paula go into a small glass-fronted room filled with well-stocked, floor-to-ceiling wine racks. Speechless is how Kate is. Nick, standing and grinning at her, is looked over at by her. A pan on the stove next to him is pointed at by Kate. The contents have caught fire. Paula is shaken her head at in disbelief by Kate, then a bag is grabbed by her and she heads out. A flicker of a smile plays on Paula's lips. The stairs are wearily climbed by Kate to her apartment. A packet of chopsticks has been sellotaped to her door. A plastic take-away bag is bent down and picked up by her. The chopsticks are taken off the door by her, and she walks inside. The hallway is walked down by her to Zoe's bedroom. Her head is poked around the open door by Kate, then she tries to enter her own bedroom. The door won't budge. It is forced open a crack by her. Zoe is seen curled up, asleep on her bed by Kate. The bathroom is walked into by her, and her bedroom is entered through an adjoining door. A chair has been propped up against the bedroom door to prevent anyone from entering. Kate walks over and moves it aside, along with a wicker laundry basket. Slowly, the bed is stepped towards by Kate, and the remote control, lying next to Zoe, is picked up by her. The TV is turned off by her. Her sleeping niece is looked down at by Kate, then she places the remote on a chest of drawers. Zoe is gently covered by her with the bedclothes, then a photo album, which had been hidden beneath them, is noticed by her. The photo album is moved around by Kate, and she begins to look through it.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She unpacks a rabbit. A plate of vegetables and a fish with an open mouth is placed before Zoe, who looks horrified as Kate squeezes lemon over it. Zoe shakes her head, and visibly disappointed, Kate watches as Zoe leaves the table. In her bedroom, Zoe plays sadly with a red-haired rag doll. Meanwhile, in a restaurant, patrons enjoy a meal. Kate enters, passing Paula by the door and moves through the busy dining area. Holding a pastry brush, a man conducts and sings to the staff with an uncooked quail in hand, astonishing Kate. Kate removes the man's coat as Paula seats a couple. Kate and Paula enter a wine room. Speechless, Kate glances at Nick, who grins while a pan beside him catches fire. Shaking her head, Kate grabs her bag and leaves, with Paula barely smiling. Kate climbs the stairs to her apartment, finding chopsticks taped to her door. She picks up a take-away bag and enters, heading to Zoe's bedroom. Finding her own bedroom door stuck, she forces it open slightly and sees Zoe asleep on her bed. Kate enters the bathroom and through an adjoining door enters her bedroom. A chair blocks the bedroom door, which she removes along with a laundry basket. Approaching the bed, she turns off the TV and gently covers Zoe with the bedclothes. Discovering a photo album hidden beneath, Kate begins to look through it.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Zoe is horrified by her dinner: a rabbit, vegetables, and a fish. Kate squeezes lemon over her fish, but Zoe shakes her head, gets up, and leaves. Now in her bedroom, Zoe plays with a red-haired rag doll, looking sad. Patrons enjoy their meals at a window table. Kate enters the restaurant, passing Paula who chats with customers. Hearing singing, Kate slows near the kitchen, meeting Bernadette exiting with plates. Inside, Leah and a man hold a pastry brush and uncooked quail. Kate watches him sing, then shakes her head at Paula, grabs her bag, and leaves as Paula smiles. At home, chopsticks are taped to Kate's door. She enters, finds the door to her bedroom blocked, and sees Zoe asleep on her bed. Entering through the bathroom, Kate removes obstacles, turns off the TV, covers Zoe, and finds a hidden photo album.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The scene opens with an intriguing moment as she carefully begins to unpack a rabbit, her motions deliberate and precise. Meanwhile, sitting at the table, a plate of fresh, vibrant vegetables, accompanied by a fish whose mouth hangs agape, is slid across the table and placed directly in front of Zoe. Zoe, filled with a palpable sense of horror, sits motionless, staring at her dinner. Beside her, Kate, with a focused expression, squeezes a fresh lemon over her own fish. Zoe, unable to mask her discomfort, slowly shakes her head in silent disapproval. Observing this, Kate's once bright smile begins to fade, morphing into a look of evident disappointment as she watches Zoe rise from her seat and leave the table behind.

In the solitude of her bedroom, Zoe sits quietly, occupying herself by playing with a cherished red-haired rag doll. She glances down, her gaze sorrowful, as she contemplates the doll, and during this reflective moment, Kate quietly exits. Meanwhile, patrons seated at a window table are in high spirits, smiling and engaging in lively conversation as they savor their meal with great enjoyment. 

Kate, making her way through a bustling environment, rounds a corner and confidently enters the busy restaurant. She strides purposefully past Paula, who stands engaged in conversation with two customers at the entrance. As Kate navigates through the crowded dining area, her progress is slowed by the sound of singing emanating from the kitchen. Approaching with curiosity, she encounters Bernadette, exiting the kitchen while deftly balancing two plates. Stepping into the kitchen, Kate finds Leah standing alongside a man equipped with a pastry brush. 

As the man turns to face her, he unexpectedly begins conducting, creating an unusual spectacle. Kate watches with disbelief, her eyes widening as the man, raising his arms theatrically, serenades the kitchen staff, holding an uncooked quail aloft in his other hand. Confronted by this scene, Kate turns to look at Paula. Swiftly, Kate removes the man's coat, whisking it off him in a fluid motion. Meanwhile, Paula, maintaining her professional demeanor, leads a couple to their designated table. 

Kate and Paula then proceed to a small, intimate room with glass-fronted walls, filled with an impressive display of floor-to-ceiling wine racks, each meticulously stocked. Kate's reaction is one of speechlessness, as she takes in the sight. Her attention shifts to Nick, who stands before her, sporting a wide grin. Kate points frantically at a pan on the stove next to him, the contents of which have alarmingly caught fire. Exchanging a look of disbelief with Paula, Kate shakes her head and, collecting her composure, grabs her bag and makes her exit. A subtle flicker of a smile plays across Paula's lips as she observes Kate's departure.

Climbing the stairs wearily to her apartment, Kate's eyes fall upon a familiar packet of chopsticks, haphazardly taped to her front door. Bending down, she retrieves a plastic take-away bag left on the doorstep. Removing the chopsticks from the door, she steps inside her home, each step echoing down the hallway as she makes her way to Zoe's bedroom. Pausing, Kate pokes her head around the open door before attempting to enter her own room. However, the door resists, refusing to budge beyond a slight crack. Through this narrow space, Kate glimpses Zoe, curled up and peacefully asleep on her bed. 

Opting for a different approach, Kate enters the bathroom and subsequently accesses her bedroom through an adjoining door. Inside, she discovers a chair deliberately propped against the bedroom door, serving as a makeshift barricade to prevent entry. With care, Kate moves the chair aside, accompanied by a wicker laundry basket blocking the way. Stepping slowly and cautiously towards her bed, she picks up the remote control lying nearby Zoe. With a gentle click, the TV is shut off. Kate gazes tenderly at her sleeping niece before placing the remote on a nearby chest of drawers. She then gently drapes the bedclothes over Zoe, ensuring her warmth and comfort. It is at this moment that Kate notices a photo album hidden beneath the bedclothes. Intrigued, she carefully rearranges the photo album and starts to leaf through its pages, becoming absorbed in its contents.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The scene begins with a captivating and intriguing moment as she meticulously and with great care begins to unpack a rabbit. Her actions are deliberate and precise, each movement thoughtful and intentional. Meanwhile, at the table, there is a plate filled with fresh, vibrant vegetables, and along with them, a fish with its mouth hung open in a permanent, wide gape. This plate is gently slid across the table and placed directly in front of Zoe. Zoe, with a visible and overwhelming sense of horror, sits frozen and motionless, her eyes fixed on the unsettling sight of her dinner. Seated beside her, Kate, focused and intent, is gently squeezing a fresh, juicy lemon over her own fish. Zoe, unable to keep her discomfort hidden, slowly shakes her head, silently expressing her disapproval. Observing this reaction, Kate's once bright and cheerful smile starts to fade, transforming into a look of evident disappointment as she watches Zoe rise from her seat and depart from the table, leaving it behind.

In the quiet solitude of her bedroom, Zoe sits quietly, finding comfort in the familiar presence of a cherished red-haired rag doll. Her gaze drops to the doll, filled with a sorrowful contemplation, as she reflects on it during this introspective moment. Quietly and without a word, Kate exits the room. Meanwhile, patrons seated at a window table are in high spirits, their faces lit with smiles as they engage in lively conversation, savoring their meal with great enjoyment and enthusiasm.

Kate, making her way through a bustling and energetic environment, confidently rounds a corner and enters the busy restaurant. She strides with purpose past Paula, who stands engaged in an animated conversation with two customers positioned at the entrance. As Kate navigates through the crowded dining area, her progress is momentarily slowed by the unexpected sound of singing that flows from the kitchen. Approaching with curiosity, she encounters Bernadette, who is exiting the kitchen while skillfully balancing two plates. Stepping into the kitchen with interest, Kate finds Leah standing next to a man who is equipped with a pastry brush.

As the man turns to face her, he unexpectedly begins conducting an impromptu performance, creating an unusual spectacle. Kate watches in disbelief, her eyes widening as the man, raising his arms dramatically, serenades the kitchen staff while holding an uncooked quail aloft in his other hand. Confronted by this bizarre scene, Kate turns her gaze to look at Paula. With swift movements, Kate removes the man's coat, whisking it off him in a seamless motion. Meanwhile, Paula, maintaining her professional poise, leads a couple to their designated table.

Kate and Paula then make their way to a small, intimate room, enclosed by glass-fronted walls and filled with an impressive display of floor-to-ceiling wine racks, each one meticulously stocked and arranged. Kate's reaction is one of speechlessness and awe as she takes in this remarkable sight. Her attention then shifts to Nick, who stands before her wearing a wide grin. Kate frantically points at a pan on the stove next to him, the contents of which have alarmingly caught fire. Exchanging a look of disbelief with Paula, Kate shakes her head and, regaining her composure, grabs her bag and makes her exit. A subtle flicker of a smile crosses Paula's lips as she observes Kate's departure.

Wearily climbing the stairs to her apartment, Kate's eyes fall upon a familiar packet of chopsticks, carelessly taped to her front door. Bending down, she retrieves a plastic take-away bag that has been left on her doorstep. Removing the chopsticks from the door, she steps inside her home, each step echoing softly down the hallway as she makes her way to Zoe's bedroom. Pausing, Kate pokes her head around the open door before attempting to enter her own room. However, the door resists her efforts, refusing to open beyond a narrow crack. Through this slender opening, Kate glimpses Zoe, peacefully curled up and asleep on her bed.

Choosing a different route, Kate enters the bathroom and subsequently accesses her bedroom through an adjoining door. Inside, she discovers a chair deliberately propped against the bedroom door, serving as a makeshift barricade to prevent entry. With care and consideration, Kate moves the chair aside, along with a wicker laundry basket that blocks the path. Stepping slowly and cautiously towards her bed, she picks up the remote control lying nearby Zoe. With a gentle click, she turns off the TV. Kate gazes tenderly at her sleeping niece before placing the remote on a nearby chest of drawers. She then gently drapes the bedclothes over Zoe, ensuring her warmth and comfort. It is at this moment that Kate notices a photo album hidden beneath the bedclothes. Intrigued, she carefully rearranges the photo album and begins to leaf through its pages, becoming absorbed in its contents.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She carefully unpacks the contents of a box to reveal a rabbit, methodically handling it with care. Meanwhile, a plate of vegetables is carefully positioned in front of Zoe, accompanied by a fish with its mouth wide open. Zoe takes a seat, her eyes fixed on her dinner with visible horror, while Kate, with deliberate movements, squeezes lemon juice over her fish. Zoe firmly shakes her head, clearly not pleased. Observing Zoe's reaction, Kate's smile gradually fades, and disappointment clouds her expression as Zoe quietly rises from her chair and leaves the dining table. Zoe retreats to her bedroom, where she sits, cradling a red-haired rag doll in her hands. As she gazes sadly down at the doll, Kate quietly exits the room. In a different scene, patrons sitting by the window in a restaurant are engaged in cheerful conversations as they enjoy their meals. Kate then rounds a corner and enters the bustling restaurant, immediately passing by Paula, who is engaged in a lively chat with two customers near the entrance. Kate navigates through the crowded dining area, her pace slowing as she approaches the kitchen, drawn by the sound of singing. She encounters Bernadette, who is emerging from the kitchen with two plates in hand. As Kate steps into the kitchen, she finds Leah standing next to a man who is holding a pastry brush. The man turns to face the room, assuming the role of a conductor. Kate watches in disbelief as the man dramatically lifts his arms and begins a song directed at the staff, all the while holding an uncooked quail in his other hand. Kate quickly turns her attention to Paula. With swift movements, she whisks the man's coat off him. Paula, meanwhile, leads the couple to their table. Kate and Paula then enter a small, glass-fronted room filled with towering, well-organized wine racks. Kate finds herself momentarily speechless, her gaze shifting to Nick, who stands nearby, grinning broadly at her. She points at the pan on the stove next to Nick, noticing that its contents have caught fire. Shaking her head in disbelief, Kate exchanges a look with Paula, then decisively grabs her bag and makes her way out of the room. A faint flicker of a smile appears on Paula's lips as Kate wearily climbs the stairs to her apartment. Upon reaching her door, she notices that a packet of chopsticks has been taped to it. Bending down, she picks up a plastic take-away bag placed on the ground. Removing the chopsticks from the door, she enters the apartment and walks down the hallway toward Zoe's bedroom. Kate carefully peeks around the slightly open door before attempting to enter her own bedroom, only to find the door won't budge. She manages to force it open slightly, revealing Zoe curled up and asleep on her bed. Entering the bathroom, Kate makes her way into her bedroom through an adjoining door, discovering a chair propped against the door, effectively barring entry. She calmly moves the chair aside, along with a wicker laundry basket. Stepping quietly toward the bed, Kate picks up the remote control lying next to Zoe, turning off the television. She gazes down at her sleeping niece, places the remote on the chest of drawers, and gently draws the bedclothes over Zoe. Noticing a photo album that had been hidden beneath the covers, Kate carefully shifts it and begins to flip through the pages, examining the memories captured within.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: She unpacks a rabbit as a plate of vegetables and a fish with a gaping mouth is slid in front of Zoe, who sits in horror while Kate squeezes lemon over the fish. Zoe, shaking her head, leaves the table, disappointing Kate. In her bedroom, Zoe plays with a red-haired rag doll, looking sadly at it as Kate departs. Meanwhile, patrons at a restaurant enjoy their meal as Kate enters, bypassing Paula, who is chatting with customers. Kate navigates the busy dining area, slowing as she hears singing near the kitchen. She encounters Bernadette with two plates and enters the kitchen, where Leah stands with a man holding a pastry brush, conducting and singing with an uncooked quail in hand. Kate, in disbelief, watches the scene, then whisks away the man's coat as Paula guides a couple to their table. Kate and Paula enter a wine-filled room where a speechless Kate notices Nick grinning and points to a flaming pan on the stove. Shaking her head at Paula, Kate grabs her bag and leaves, catching a flicker of a smile from Paula. Kate wearily climbs the stairs to her apartment, finding chopsticks taped to the door and a plastic take-away bag, which she collects before heading down the hallway to Zoe's room. Peeking into Zoe's room, she attempts to enter her own bedroom, which is blocked by a propped chair and wicker basket. She forces the door open a crack, sees Zoe asleep, and enters through the adjoining bathroom door. Moving the obstacles, Kate approaches the bed, turns off the TV, and gently covers Zoe with the bedclothes. She discovers a hidden photo album beneath them and begins to look through it.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
She unpacks a rabbit, a delicacy often prepared in gourmet recipes. A plate of vegetables, including heirloom carrots and sautéed greens known for their rich flavor, and a fish with a gaping mouth, a traditional sign of freshness in seafood, is slid in front of Zoe. Zoe sits and stares at her dinner in horror, as Kate, a skilled cook who enjoys using fresh citrus for zest, squeezes lemon over her fish. Zoe shakes her head. Kate's smile fades and she looks disappointed as Zoe gets up and leaves the table. Zoe sits in her bedroom, playing with a red-haired rag doll that her grandmother made for her when she was a toddler. Zoe looks sadly down at her doll as Kate goes. Patrons sitting in a window table of the bustling downtown bistro smile and chat as they enjoy a meal. 

Kate rounds a corner and enters the restaurant, renowned for its fusion cuisine, walking straight past Paula, the friendly hostess known for remembering regulars' names, who's standing by the door chatting to two customers. Kate makes her way through the crowded dining area. Hearing singing, Kate slows down as she nears the kitchen, where the staff often break into song after shifts. She meets Bernadette coming out with two plates, balancing them with the finesse of a seasoned waitress. Kate walks into the kitchen. Leah's standing with a man holding a pastry brush, an essential tool for glazing pastries. The man, an eccentric chef known for his theatrical personality, turns. He conducts, as if leading an orchestra. Kate watches in disbelief as the man raises his arms in the air and sings to the staff. He's holding an uncooked quail, ready for the evening's special, in his other hand. Kate turns to Paula. Kate whisks the man's coat off him, a gesture signaling the end of his impromptu performance. Paula leads the couple to their table with her usual grace. 

Kate and Paula go into a small glass-fronted room filled with well-stocked, floor-to-ceiling wine racks, which hold a collection featuring rare vintages. Kate's speechless. She looks over at Nick, who stands grinning at her, a mischievous line cook with a knack for practical jokes. Kate points at a pan on the stove next to him. The contents have caught fire, a common hazard in busy kitchens. Kate shakes her head at Paula in disbelief, then grabs her bag and heads out, tired after a long day. A flicker of a smile plays on Paula's lips, the sign of someone who has seen it all. 

Kate wearily climbs the stairs to her apartment, which is located above the restaurant. A packet of chopsticks, a humorous reminder of the night’s mishaps, have been sellotaped to her door. She bends down and picks up a plastic take-away bag, left by a thoughtful neighbor who knows her busy schedule. She takes the chopsticks off the door and walks inside. She walks down the hallway to Zoe's bedroom. Kate pokes her head around the open door, then tries to enter her own bedroom. The door won't budge. She forces it open a crack. Kate sees Zoe curled up, asleep on her bed, clutching a stuffed toy rabbit. Kate walks into the bathroom and enters her bedroom through an adjoining door. A chair has been propped up against the bedroom door to prevent anyone from entering, a sign of Zoe's fear of sleeping alone. Kate walks over and moves it aside, along with a wicker laundry basket. Kate steps slowly towards the bed and picks up the remote control, which is lying next to Zoe. She turns off the TV, which was playing a cartoon. Kate looks down at her sleeping niece, then places the remote on a chest of drawers. She gently covers Zoe with the bedclothes, then notices a photo album, filled with family photos and memories, which had been hidden beneath them. Kate moves the photo album around and begins to look through it, reminiscing about days gone by.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: She unpacks a rabbit. A plate of vegetables and a fish with a gaping mouth is slid in front of Zoe. Zoe sits and stares at her dinner in horror as Kate squeezes lemon over her fish. Zoe shakes her head. Kate's smile fades and she looks disappointed as Zoe gets up and leaves the table. Zoe sits in her bedroom playing with a redhaired rag doll. Zoe looks sadly down at her doll as Kate goes. Patrons sitting in a window table smile and chat as they enjoy a meal. Kate rounds a corner and enters the restaurant walking straight past Paula who is standing by the door chatting to two customers. Kate makes her way through the crowded dining area. Hearing singing. Kate slows down as she nears the kitchen. She meets Bernadette coming out with two plates. Kate walks into the kitchen. Leah's standing with a man holding a pastry brush. The man turns He conducts. Kate watches in disbelief as the man raises his arms in the air and sings to the staff. He is holding an uncooked quail in his other hand. Kate turns to Paula. Kate whisks the man's coat off him. Paula leads the couple to their table. Kate and Paula go into a small glassfronted room filled with wellstocked floortoceiling wine racks. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. Kate's speechless. She looks over at Nick who stands grinning at her. Kate points at a pan on the stove next to him. The contents have caught fire. Kate shakes her head at Paula in disbelief then grabs her bag and heads out. A flicker of a smile plays on Paula's lips. Kate wearily climbs the stairs to her apartment. A packet of chopsticks have been sellotaped to her door. She bends down and picks up a plastic takeaway bag. She takes the chopsticks off the door and walks inside. She walks down the hallway to Zoe's bedroom. Kate pokes her head around the open door then tries to enter her own bedroom. The door will not budge. She forces it open a crack. Kate sees Zoe curled up asleep on her bed. Kate walks into the bathroom and enters her bedroom through an adjoining door. A chair has been propped up against the bedroom door to prevent anyone from entering. Kate walks over and moves it aside along with a wicker laundry basket. Kate steps slowly towards the bed and picks up the remote control which is lying next to Zoe. She turns off the TV. Kate looks down at her sleeping niece then places the remote on a chest of drawers. She gently covers Zoe with the bedclothes then notices a photo album which had been hidden beneath them. Kate moves the photo album around and begins to look through it.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffe unpacks a rabbit. A plate of vegetables and a fish with a gaping mouth is slid in front of the owl. The owl sits and stares at her dinner in horror, as the elephant squeezes lemon over her fish. The owl shakes her head. The elephant's smile fades and the elephant looks disappointed as the owl gets up and leaves the table. The owl sits in her bedroom, playing with a red-haired rag doll. The owl looks sadly down at her doll as the kangaroo goes. Patrons sitting in a window table smile and chat as they enjoy a meal. The elephant rounds a corner and enters the restaurant, walking straight past the penguin who's standing by the door chatting to two customers. The elephant makes her way through the crowded dining area. Hearing singing, the elephant slows down as she nears the kitchen. She meets the ostrich coming out with two plates. The elephant walks into the kitchen. The flamingo's standing with a man holding a pastry brush. The man turns. He conducts. The elephant watches in disbelief as the man raises his arms in the air and sings to the staff. He's holding an uncooked quail in his other hand. The elephant turns to the penguin. The elephant whisks the man's coat off him. The penguin leads the couple to their table. The elephant and the penguin go into a small glass-fronted room filled with well-stocked, floor-to-ceiling wine racks. The elephant's speechless. She looks over at the koala, who stands grinning at her. The elephant points at a pan on the stove next to him. The contents have caught fire. The elephant shakes her head at the penguin in disbelief, then grabs her bag and heads out. A flicker of a smile plays on the penguin's lips. The elephant wearily climbs the stairs to her apartment. A packet of chopsticks have been sellotaped to her door. She bends down and picks up a plastic take-away bag. She takes the chopsticks off the door and walks inside. She walks down the hallway to the owl's bedroom. The elephant pokes her head around the open door, then tries to enter her own bedroom. The door won't budge. She forces it open a crack. The elephant sees the owl curled up, asleep on her bed. The elephant walks into the bathroom and enters her bedroom through an adjoining door. A chair has been propped up against the bedroom door to prevent anyone from entering. The elephant walks over and moves it aside, along with a wicker laundry basket. The elephant steps slowly towards the bed and picks up the remote control, which is lying next to the owl. She turns off the TV. The elephant looks down at her sleeping niece, then places the remote on a chest of drawers. She gently covers the owl with the bedclothes, then notices a photo album, which had been hidden beneath them. The elephant moves the photo album around and begins to look through it.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She unpacks a statuette. A bowl of fruit and a loaf with a crusty top is slid in front of Zoe. Zoe sits and stares at her dinner in disbelief, as Kate sprinkles cinnamon over her loaf. Zoe shakes her head. Kate's smile fades and she looks disappointed as Zoe gets up and leaves the booth. Zoe sits in her study, playing with a dark-haired marionette. Zoe looks sadly down at her marionette as Kate departs. Guests sitting in an outdoor patio smile and chat as they enjoy a feast. Kate rounds a corner and enters the library, walking straight past Paula who's standing by the door chatting to two visitors. Kate makes her way through the crowded reading area. Hearing humming, Kate slows down as she nears the archive. She meets Bernadette coming out with two scrolls. Kate walks into the archive. Leah's standing with a man holding a paintbrush. The man turns. He directs. Kate watches in disbelief as the man raises his arms in the air and sings to the librarians. He's holding an uncooked pheasant in his other hand. Kate turns to Paula. Kate whisks the man's jacket off him. Paula leads the couple to their seats. Kate and Paula go into a small glass-fronted room filled with well-stocked, floor-to-ceiling bookcases. Kate's speechless. She looks over at Nick, who stands grinning at her. Kate points at a kettle on the counter next to him. The contents have boiled over. Kate shakes her head at Paula in disbelief, then grabs her satchel and heads out. A flicker of a smile plays on Paula's lips. Kate wearily climbs the stairs to her studio. A packet of matches have been taped to her door. She bends down and picks up a paper gift bag. She takes the matches off the door and walks inside. She walks down the hallway to Zoe's study. Kate pokes her head around the open door, then tries to enter her own studio. The door won't budge. She forces it open a crack. Kate sees Zoe curled up, asleep on her futon. Kate walks into the washroom and enters her studio through an adjoining door. A bookshelf has been propped up against the studio door to prevent anyone from entering. Kate walks over and moves it aside, along with a woven storage basket. Kate steps slowly towards the futon and picks up the flashlight, which is lying next to Zoe. She turns off the lamp. Kate looks down at her sleeping niece, then places the flashlight on a side table. She gently covers Zoe with the blanket, then notices a scrapbook, which had been hidden beneath them. Kate moves the scrapbook around and begins to look through it.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She unwraps a rabbit. A plate of vegetables and a fish with a gaping mouth is thrust in front of Zoe. Zoe stands and glances at her dinner in confusion, as Kate sprinkles salt over her fish. Zoe bows her head. Kate's smile disappears and she looks frustrated as Zoe sits down and stays at the table. Zoe stands in her bedroom, dancing with a red-haired rag doll. Zoe gazes intently down at her doll as Kate arrives. Patrons sitting in a window table laugh and sing as they discuss a meal. Kate turns a corner and exits the restaurant, walking quickly past Paula who's standing by the door listening to two customers. Kate maneuvers her way through the lively dining area. Hearing laughter, Kate speeds up as she approaches the kitchen. She passes Bernadette going out with two plates. Kate bursts into the kitchen. Leah's standing with a man holding a paintbrush. The man spins. He signals. Kate listens in amazement as the man lowers his arms to the ground and speaks to the staff. He's holding a raw quail in his other hand. Kate gestures to Paula. Kate drapes the man's coat on him. Paula accompanies the couple away from their table. Kate and Paula enter a small glass-fronted room filled with empty, floor-to-ceiling wine racks. Kate's astonished. She looks over at Nick, who sits frowning at her. Kate glances at a pan on the stove next to him. The contents have cooled down. Kate nods her head at Paula in agreement, then grabs her phone and heads inside. A flicker of a frown crosses Paula's lips. Kate eagerly descends the stairs from her apartment. A packet of chopsticks has been pinned to her door. She stands up and lifts a plastic take-away bag. She leaves the chopsticks on the door and walks outside. She walks up the hallway from Zoe's bedroom. Kate pulls her head away from the open door, then attempts to exit her own bedroom. The door swings open. She closes it a crack. Kate notices Zoe stretched out, awake on her bed. Kate runs into the bathroom and exits her bedroom through an adjoining door. A chair has been moved away from the bedroom door to allow anyone to enter. Kate stands over and leaves it aside, along with a wicker laundry basket. Kate runs quickly towards the bed and tosses the remote control, which is lying next to Zoe. She turns on the TV. Kate gazes at her sleeping niece, then places the remote on a chest of drawers. She gently nudges Zoe with the bedclothes, then notices a photo album, which had been placed beneath them. Kate leaves the photo album in place and starts to walk away from it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She unpacks a toaster. A stack of books and a sock with a gaping hole is slid in front of a painting. The painting sits and stares at its mirror in horror, as a bicycle squeezes toothpaste over its sock. The painting shakes its frame. The bicycle's smile fades and it looks disappointed as the painting gets up and leaves the hammock. The painting sits in its closet, playing with a green-haired teddy bear. The painting looks sadly down at its bear as the bicycle goes. Statues sitting in a window chair smile and chat as they enjoy a melody. The bicycle rounds a bush and enters the library, walking straight past a suitcase who's standing by the window chatting to two hats. The bicycle makes its way through the crowded reading section. Hearing humming, the bicycle slows down as it nears the desk. It meets a calendar coming out with two scrolls. The bicycle walks into the desk. A notebook's standing with a lamp holding a feather duster. The lamp turns. It conducts. The bicycle watches in disbelief as the lamp raises its wires in the air and sings to the pencils. It's holding an uncooked pencil sharpener in its other wire. The bicycle turns to the suitcase. The bicycle whisks the lamp's scarf off it. The suitcase leads the shoelaces to their hammock. The bicycle and the suitcase go into a small glass-fronted shelf filled with well-stocked, floor-to-ceiling book stacks. The bicycle's speechless. It looks over at a shelf, who stands grinning at it. The bicycle points at a jar on the countertop next to it. The contents have caught fire. The bicycle shakes its wheels at the suitcase in disbelief, then grabs its helmet and heads out. A flicker of a smile plays on the suitcase's pocket. The bicycle wearily climbs the ladder to its loft. A packet of noodles has been sellotaped to its handle. It bends down and picks up a cloth shopping bag. It takes the noodles off the handle and walks inside. It rolls down the corridor to the painting's closet. The bicycle pokes its handle around the open window, then tries to enter its own closet. The window won't budge. It forces it open a crack. The bicycle sees the painting curled up, asleep on its table. The bicycle rolls into the study and enters its closet through an adjoining window. A lamp has been propped up against the closet window to prevent anyone from entering. The bicycle rolls over and moves it aside, along with a wicker wastebasket. The bicycle steps slowly towards the table and picks up the flashlight, which is lying next to the painting. It turns off the radio. The bicycle looks down at its sleeping clock, then places the flashlight on a chest of shelves. It gently covers the painting with the tablecloth, then notices a comic book, which had been hidden beneath them. The bicycle moves the comic book around and begins to look through it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He unwraps a hamster. A platter of cookies and a chicken with bulging eyes is pushed in front of Tim. Tim lounges and gazes at his dessert in disbelief, as Sally drizzles honey over her chicken. Tim nods his head. Sally's grin disappears and she looks frustrated as Tim rises and exits the room. Tim sits in his living room, reading a book with a green-haired puppet. Tim glances joyfully at his puppet as Sally departs. Visitors relaxing at a patio table frown and argue as they avoid a meal. Sally skips around a pillar and exits the bakery, strolling straight past Clara who's lounging by the entrance listening to two colleagues. Sally weaves her way through the spacious lounge area. Hearing whistling, Sally speeds up as she nears the pantry. She meets Darlene entering with two pastries. Sally steps into the pantry. Beth's seated with a woman holding a wooden spoon. The woman smiles. She lectures. Sally listens in shock as the woman lowers her arms and whispers to the team. She's clutching a raw sparrow in her other hand. Sally glances at Clara. Sally yanks the woman's hat off her. Clara escorts the trio to their booth. Sally and Clara sneak into a tiny wood-paneled office adorned with overflowing, wall-to-wall bookcases. Sally's astounded. She gestures over at Jake, who sits frowning at her. Sally points at a kettle on the counter beside him. The contents have started boiling. Sally nods her head at Clara in wonder, then snatches her coat and heads in. A glimmer of a grin flits across Clara's face. Sally eagerly descends the stairs to her home. A bunch of combs have been glued to her wall. She stoops down and picks up a cardboard grocery bag. She tugs the combs off the wall and steps outside. She saunters up the driveway to Tim's living room. Sally peers her head around the closed door, then struggles to push open her own living room. The door won't shift. She forces it open a sliver. Sally sees Tim sprawled out, dreaming on her couch. Sally steps into the kitchen and exits her living room via a connecting hallway. A cushion has been wedged against the lounge door to deter anyone from entering. Sally inches forward and moves it aside, along with a woven picnic basket. Sally ambles slowly towards the couch and picks up the novel, which is resting beside Tim. She puts away the book. Sally peers at her slumbering nephew, then places the novel on a stack of magazines. She gently covers Tim with the afghan, then notices a sketchbook, which was hidden beneath them. Sally shifts the sketchbook aside and begins to examine it.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She releases a turtle. A bowl of fruit and a statue with a missing arm is floated in front of Zoe. Zoe stands and blinks at her dessert in surprise, as Kate sprinkles glitter over her statue. Zoe nods her head. Kate's grin vanishes and she looks puzzled as Zoe rises and exits the bench. Zoe lounges in her living room, petting a brown-haired teddy bear. Zoe gazes thoughtfully at her teddy as Kate departs. Guests sitting at a window booth laugh and gossip as they savor a snack. Kate turns a corner and enters the library, walking straight past Paula who's standing by the entrance greeting two visitors. Kate makes her way through the bustling reading area. Hearing laughter, Kate speeds up as she approaches the archive. She meets Bernadette stepping out with two books. Kate enters the archive. Leah's standing with a woman holding a feather duster. The woman spins. She dances. Kate watches in awe as the woman lifts her hands in the air and twirls to the staff. She's holding a decorative vase in her other hand. Kate turns to Paula. Kate whisks the woman's scarf off her. Paula leads the pair to their booth. Kate and Paula wander into a small glass-walled room filled with well-organized, floor-to-ceiling bookcases. Kate's speechless. She glances over at Nick, who stands nodding at her. Kate gestures at a clock on the wall next to him. The hands have stopped. Kate nods at Paula in astonishment, then grabs her scarf and leaves. A hint of a grin graces Paula's lips. Kate slowly ascends the steps to her flat. A bundle of pencils have been glued to her door. She crouches down and picks up a paper gift bag. She takes the pencils off the door and steps inside. She walks down the hallway to Zoe's playroom. Kate peers around the open door, then attempts to enter her own study. The door won't shift. She pushes it open a bit. Kate sees Zoe sprawled out, napping on her couch. Kate enters the lounge and slips into her study through a connecting door. A stool has been placed against the study door to block access. Kate walks over and moves it aside, along with a woven picnic basket. Kate steps cautiously towards the couch and picks up the game controller, which is lying next to Zoe. She switches off the console. Kate gazes at her slumbering niece, then places the controller on a bookshelf. She gently drapes the throw over Zoe, then notices a comic book, which had been tucked beneath it. Kate shifts the comic book aside and starts to flip through it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He constructs a turtle. A bowl of marbles and a snake with a smiling face is tossed in front of Alan. Alan jumps and dances at his feast in joy, as Sam sprinkles pepper over his snake. Alan claps his hands. Sam's grin grows and he looks amused as Alan stands up and joins the couch. Alan jumps in his garage, juggling with a yellow-tailed toy robot. Alan glances happily up at his robot as Sam departs. Hikers standing on a balcony deck frown and whisper as they ponder a puzzle. Sam skips a bridge and exits the library, running straight past Martin who's reclining by the window waiting for two bakers. Sam skips her path through the spacious dancing zone. Hearing drumming, Sam speeds up as she nears the ballroom. She sees Tiffany entering with four trays. Sam jumps into the ballroom. Oliver's lounging with a dog using a paint roller. The dog spins. It pirouettes. Sam giggles in shock as the dog lowers its snout in the water and howls to the clouds. It's holding a cooked salmon in its left paw. Sam flinches at Martin. Sam drags the dog's hat off him. Martin directs the trio to the deck. Sam and Martin sneak into a tiny wooden-floored shed filled with worn-out, waist-high shoe racks. Sam's gobsmacked. She peers over at Linda, who lounges smirking at her. Sam nods at a kettle on the fridge beside him. The kettle's contents have frozen solid. Sam claps her hands at Martin in amusement, then retrieves her cap and strolls in. A flicker of a frown forms on Martin's forehead. Sam leisurely hops down the elevator to her basement. A stack of spoons have been pinned to her chair. She jumps up and grabs a cardboard snack box. She removes the spoons from the chair and skips outside. She skips up the staircase to Alan's garage. Sam slides her foot around the closed window, then sneaks to enter her own living room. The window can't move. She pries it open a smidge. Sam spots Alan unfolded, awake on her couch. Sam skips into the kitchen and exits her living room through an adjacent window. A lamp has been fastened up against the living room window to hinder anyone from departing. Sam skips over and shifts it aside, along with a woven trash basket. Sam walks quickly away from the couch and grabs the fishing net, which is sitting beside Alan. She switches on the fan. Sam glances up at her climbing nephew, then places the fishing net on a pile of books. She loudly uncovers Alan with the curtains, then notices a picture frame, which had been placed above them. Sam lifts the picture frame aside and begins to peek under it.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Zoe is horrified by her dinner of fish and vegetables, unlike Kate, who enjoys her meal. Disappointed by Zoe's reaction, Kate leaves the table, and Zoe retreats to her bedroom with a rag doll. Later, Kate enters a bustling restaurant, brushes past Paula, and is startled by a singing man in the kitchen holding an uncooked quail. Kate is unimpressed by the chaos as she notices Nick smiling while a pan catches fire. Frustrated, she leaves, grabbing her bag. At her apartment, Kate finds chopsticks taped to her door and a take-out bag. She enters her bedroom through the bathroom to find Zoe asleep, having blocked the door with furniture. Kate quietly tidies up, covers Zoe with bedclothes, and discovers a hidden photo album beneath them, which she begins to explore.

looks down at her sleeping niece then places the remote on a chest of drawers She turns off the TV Kate steps slowly towards the bed and picks up the remote control which is lying next to Zoe Kate
